endemo2.general.country_containers.NutsRegion¶

class NutsRegion(region_name, historical_data=None, prediction_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents one NUTS Region according to individual codes. It is build as a tree structure to include sub-regions as child nodes. The leafs are NUTS2 regions.

Variables:

  • region_name (str) – The NUTS tag of the region. For example: DE, DE1, DE11, …

  • _subregions (dict[str, NutsRegion]) – The child regions, accessible per NUTS tag. For DE: {DE1 -> .., DE2 -> ..}

  • _ts_population (Timeseries) – The timeseries for the regions population. Should only be filled for leaf nodes.

  • _population_historical ([(float, float)]) – The historical population for this region. Should only be filled for leaf nodes.

Methods

Traverses the NUTS Tree recursively to insert region node.

Get a list of all leaf nodes order.

NutsRegion

get_pop(year)[source]¶

Get the amount of population in a certain year. Uses historical data when available, else does a prognosis.

Parameters:

year (int) – The target year.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The amount of population in a certain year, historical or prognosis.

get_pop_his_year(year)[source]¶

Get the historical population of self for a certain year.

Parameters:

year (int) – The target year.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The population amount of a certain year, as recorded in historical data.

get_pop_perc_of_subregion_in_year(region_obj, year)[source]¶

Calculate the percentage of the population proportion in given subregion. The population of self denotes 100%.

Parameters:

  • region_obj (NutsRegion) – Region object of the subregion which population proportion should be used.

  • year (int) – Year the population proportion should be calculated for.

Returns:

The percentage of subregion population that makes up population of self.

Recursively calculate and sum up the prognosis for all leaf regions.

Parameters:

year (int) – The year the prognosis should be done for.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The population amount prognosis for this region.
